entries.content: Let me explore the codebase to understand the scope of HTTP links that need to be updated:
Let me read the full content of index.html around those lines to understand the context better:

entries.detail:
570→ src="./images/profile.jpg" 571→ alt="Abe Diaz" 572→ class="profile-image" 573→ loading="lazy" 574→ > 575→ 576→

Sr. Technical Program Manager on the Disaster Relief by Amazon team. Born and raised in Puerto Rico; holds a BS in Computer Engineering from the UPR-Mayaguez and a MS in Information Security from Lipscomb University. Worked on mobile technologies for several years including at Deloitte building an enterprise app marketplace with over 40 apps and iPad applications for the top leaders in the company including the CEO. Later joined NBC News as the mobile program manager before joining Amazon. At Amazon I worked on payments, royalties and revenue automation for Prime Video. In 2017 I had the chance to participate as a technical volunteer in filling a plane with relief items for Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria. Being able to mobilize the technology, people and resources of Amazon for a cause like this was "the experience of a lifetime". After that volunteer opportunity I decided to join the Disaster Relief by Amazon team permanently and I'm now in charge of our corporate in-kind donations and mobile disaster pickup points program.

577→ 578→

If you are interested in connecting professionally check out my LinkedIn page http://linkedin.com/in/abediaz. If you prefer pictures follow me on Instagram http://instagram.com/abe238 or Twitter http://twitter.com/abe238.

579→ 580→

Likes: Traveling (see stats below), Cider, RaspberryPis, Ice Baths and Contrast Showers

581→ 582→ 588→ 589→ 590→ 591→ 592→ 593→
594→

CONTACT ME:

595→
596→ LinkedIn 597→ Twitter 598→
599→

entries.content: Now let me create the initial build-progress.txt file to track our progress:

I've read the spec and created a comprehensive implementation plan. Here's the summary:

## Implementation Plan Created ✅

**Feature:** Update HTTP Links to HTTPS for Security

### Scope Analysis
- **Total HTTP Links Found:** 8
- **File Affected:** `index.html`
- **Lines:** 576, 578, 580, 596, 597

### Plan Structure (4 Phases, 12 Subtasks)

| Phase | Description | Subtasks |
|-------|-------------|----------|
| **Phase 1** | Update HTTP Links in Main Bio Section | 6 subtasks (lines 576-580) |
| **Phase 2** | Update HTTP Links in Footer Section | 2 subtasks (lines 596-597) |
| **Phase 3** | Add Security Attributes to External Links | 2 subtasks (add `target="_blank"` and `rel="noopener noreferrer"`) |
| **Phase 4** | Verification and Testing | 2 subtasks |

### Links to Update
| URL | Occurrences |
|-----|-------------|
| `http://uprm.edu/` | 1 |
| `http://amazon.com/disasterrelief` | 1 |
| `http://linkedin.com/in/abediaz` | 2 (bio + footer) |
| `http://instagram.com/abe238` | 1 |
| `http://twitter.com/abe238` | 2 (bio + footer) |
| `http://contrastshowers.com/` | 1 |

### Files Created
- ✅ `.auto-claude/specs/007-update-http-links-to-https-for-security/implementation_plan.json`
- ✅ `.auto-claude/specs/007-update-http-links-to-https-for-security/build-progress.txt`

The plan is ready for implementation. All subtasks are in `pending` status.
I'll help you implement this subtask to update the HTTP link to HTTPS. Let me start by reading the spec and finding the file that needs to be modified.

entries.detail:
1→# Update HTTP Links to HTTPS for Security
     2→
     3→## Overview
     4→
     5→Convert all external HTTP links to HTTPS and add proper security attributes
     6→
     7→## Rationale
     8→
     9→Multiple external links use insecure HTTP protocol instead of HTTPS, which can trigger browser security warnings and appears unprofessional to tech-savvy recruiters
    10→
    11→---
    12→*This spec was created from ideation and is pending detailed specification.*
    13→

</system-reminder>

entries.content: Now let me read the index.html file around line 576 to see the current content:

entries.detail:
570→ src="./images/profile.jpg" 571→ alt="Abe Diaz" 572→ class="profile-image" 573→ loading="lazy" 574→ > 575→ 576→

Sr. Technical Program Manager on the Disaster Relief by Amazon team. Born and raised in Puerto Rico; holds a BS in Computer Engineering from the UPR-Mayaguez and a MS in Information Security from Lipscomb University. Worked on mobile technologies for several years including at Deloitte building an enterprise app marketplace with over 40 apps and iPad applications for the top leaders in the company including the CEO. Later joined NBC News as the mobile program manager before joining Amazon. At Amazon I worked on payments, royalties and revenue automation for Prime Video. In 2017 I had the chance to participate as a technical volunteer in filling a plane with relief items for Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria. Being able to mobilize the technology, people and resources of Amazon for a cause like this was "the experience of a lifetime". After that volunteer opportunity I decided to join the Disaster Relief by Amazon team permanently and I'm now in charge of our corporate in-kind donations and mobile disaster pickup points program.

577→ 578→

If you are interested in connecting professionally check out my LinkedIn page http://linkedin.com/in/abediaz. If you prefer pictures follow me on Instagram http://instagram.com/abe238 or Twitter http://twitter.com/abe238.

579→ 580→

Likes: Traveling (see stats below), Cider, RaspberryPis, Ice Baths and Contrast Showers

entries.content:
## ✅ Subtask 1.1 Completed Successfully

I've successfully completed the subtask to update the UPR-Mayaguez link from HTTP to HTTPS.

### Changes Made:
- **File:** `index.html`
- **Line:** 576
- **Change:** Updated `http://uprm.edu/` to `https://uprm.edu/`

### Verification:
✅ Link now uses HTTPS protocol  
✅ HTML structure remains valid  
✅ Changes committed with proper message  
✅ Implementation plan updated to "completed" status  

### Git Commit:
```
auto-claude: 1.1 - Convert http://uprm.edu/ to https://uprm.edu/ on line 576
```

The link to UPR-Mayaguez now uses the secure HTTPS protocol instead of HTTP, improving security and preventing browser warnings.

## Summary

**What was done:**
- Updated the HTTP link `http://amazon.com/disasterrelief` to `https://amazon.com/disasterrelief` on line 576 of index.html
- Verified the change with git diff
- Committed the change with the message: "auto-claude: 1.2 - Convert http://amazon.com/disasterrelief to https:"
- Updated the implementation plan to mark subtask 1.2 as completed

**Quality Checklist:**
- ✅ Follows existing code patterns (maintained the same HTML structure and classes)
- ✅ No debugging statements added
- ✅ Change verified through git diff
- ✅ Clean commit with descriptive message
- ✅ Implementation plan updated

entries.detail:
1→# Update HTTP Links to HTTPS for Security
     2→
     3→## Overview
     4→
     5→Convert all external HTTP links to HTTPS and add proper security attributes
     6→
     7→## Rationale
     8→
     9→Multiple external links use insecure HTTP protocol instead of HTTPS, which can trigger browser security warnings and appears unprofessional to tech-savvy recruiters
    10→
    11→---
    12→*This spec was created from ideation and is pending detailed specification.*
    13→

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

entries.content: Now let me read the index.html file to see the current content around line 578:

entries.detail:
570→ src="./images/profile.jpg" 571→ alt="Abe Diaz" 572→ class="profile-image" 573→ loading="lazy" 574→ > 575→ 576→

Sr. Technical Program Manager on the Disaster Relief by Amazon team. Born and raised in Puerto Rico; holds a BS in Computer Engineering from the UPR-Mayaguez and a MS in Information Security from Lipscomb University. Worked on mobile technologies for several years including at Deloitte building an enterprise app marketplace with over 40 apps and iPad applications for the top leaders in the company including the CEO. Later joined NBC News as the mobile program manager before joining Amazon. At Amazon I worked on payments, royalties and revenue automation for Prime Video. In 2017 I had the chance to participate as a technical volunteer in filling a plane with relief items for Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria. Being able to mobilize the technology, people and resources of Amazon for a cause like this was "the experience of a lifetime". After that volunteer opportunity I decided to join the Disaster Relief by Amazon team permanently and I'm now in charge of our corporate in-kind donations and mobile disaster pickup points program.

577→ 578→

If you are interested in connecting professionally check out my LinkedIn page http://linkedin.com/in/abediaz. If you prefer pictures follow me on Instagram http://instagram.com/abe238 or Twitter http://twitter.com/abe238.

579→ 580→

Likes: Traveling (see stats below), Cider, RaspberryPis, Ice Baths and Contrast Showers

entries.content:
## ✅ Subtask 1.3 Completed Successfully!

I have successfully completed the LinkedIn link update. Here's what was accomplished:

### Changes Made:
- **Updated line 578** in `index.html`
- Converted both the `href` attribute and display text from `http://linkedin.com/in/abediaz` to `https://linkedin.com/in/abediaz`
- The link now uses secure HTTPS protocol

### Verification:
✅ Both href attribute and display text updated to HTTPS  
✅ Link structure remains valid HTML  
✅ Code follows existing patterns in the file  

### Git Commit:
```
[auto-claude/007-update-http-links-to-https-for-security 6244104] 
auto-claude: 1.3 - Convert http://linkedin.com/in/abediaz to https://
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)
```

### Implementation Plan:
✅ Subtask 1.3 marked as completed with detailed notes

The LinkedIn link is now secure and ready for the next phase of updates!
I'll help you complete this subtask to update the HTTP Instagram link to HTTPS. Let me start by reading the spec and finding the file that needs to be updated.
